Title: Data Curation Lead (Policy/Training)

Experience & Skills:

Bachelors/Masters degree or equivalent 
1+ years of experience in managing training processes and developing documentation for operational teams (data curation, customer service, or similar).
Strong organizational and presentation skills with attention to detail.

Ability to define policies and operational workflows that meet project expectations, monitor and assess policies, and quickly adapt to changes.

Comfortable learning and using new processes, systems, and tools, including data labeling tools and Google Workspace products.

Project/process management experience, including planning, coordination, and monitoring of training programs.
Background in mapping, cartography and any related fields. Experience using Open Street Map. 
Experience with data entry or data labeling
Experience working with vendors and partners
Experience with Jira, Confluence

Professional and stable working environment.
The latest technology and equipment you need.

Title: Corporate Communications Manager
RoleDescription:
At Lyft, our purpose is to serve and connect. To do this, we start with our own community by fostering a respectful and diverse organization where every voice is heard, valued, and empowered to contribute to our shared success.
We are seeking a Corporate Communications Manager to build our companys reputation, telling the Lyft story to the world through traditional, new, and emerging media. In this role, youll contribute to every phase of the storytelling process, including strategic planning, proactive media engagement, and tactical execution of our communications strategies. Successful candidates will be able to craft a narrative from data and stories they uncover, and have experience working with media and influencers.. Ideally, youll have previous experience managing projects and supporting high-visibility company announcements, and are comfortable building relationships and collaborating with our teammates in other areas of the business. 
The ideal candidate for this role will also be comfortable navigating ambiguity and switching gears quickly, jumping into reactive issues as needed. The Corporate Communications Manager will work with the Senior Manager of Corporate Communications to manage corporate reputation through response work with national and local media. 
This is an opportunity to join a creative, collaborative team of problem-solvers and help tell the next chapter of the Lyft story. The role reports to the Director of Corporate Communications.
Responsibilities:

Drive proactive corporate announcements from strategy to execution, working cross-functionally to ensure compelling framing and secure media coverage of company news
Own and maintain our corporate messaging library, incorporating latest data, framing, and product updates
Organize and maintain a list of regular beat reporters, taking ownership of relationships with local media contacts
Work closely with peers on the external (and internal) communications team to ensure integrated planning and execution.
Serve as a company spokesperson on high stakes and high profile issues.
Collaborate with the Senior Communications Manager to support media relations on reactive issues across the United States and Canada, including drafting statements / responses and providing background information to help reporters understand Lyfts policies, features, and positions on safety. 
Partner with the corporate, product and consumer communications teams to create pitches relating to advance Lyfts overall narrative.
Provide strategic communication support to senior executives, including preparing talking points and other key communications to effectively represent the company in public forums.
Work in partnership with functions across the company - including operations, legal/compliance, insurance, product, and customer experience - to ensure stories are reported accurately.

Experience:

5+ years of communications experience.
Demonstrated focus on corporate communications at large companies.
Ability to fluidly navigate between strategy and execution (can develop high-level strategic plans and also ensure high-quality execution). 
Proven success building strategic communications plans across external channels including owned, earned, social, and emerging media.  
Unusually strong writing and business communication skills. 
A track record of building strong relationships across organizational boundaries.
Experience working directly with national and local media to shape stories proactively and reactively.

Title: Data Scientist, Decisions - Mapping
RoleDescription:
At Lyft, our purpose is to serve and connect. To do this, we start with our own community by creating an open, inclusive, and diverse organization.
As a Data Scientist on the Mapping team, you will collaborate with our world class team of engineers, product managers, and designers to grow and improve the quality of recommended routes and accuracy of our travel time estimations. We're looking for a passionate, driven Data Scientist who is excited to dive into our spatial data and build a best-in-class mapping product that provides safe, efficient, and seamless navigation for our rideshare drivers.
Data Science is at the heart of Lyfts products and decision-making. You will leverage data and rigorous, analytical thinking to shape our mapping products and make business decisions that put our customers first. This will involve identifying and scoping opportunities, shaping priorities, recommending technical solutions, designing experiments, and measuring the impact of new features. You will help us solve some of the most impactful problems in mapping, including:

How do we improve the quality of our map data in order to improve our recommendations?
How do we benchmark and measure the success of our services?
How do we validate features of the real world that affect our routing algorithms?

Establish metrics that measure the health of our products, as well as rider and driver experience
Drive cross-org impact and alignment, shaping product and business strategy through data-centric presentations

4+ years experience in a data science role or analytics role

Experience in programming, especially with data science and visualization libraries in Python or R, and machine learning libraries such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, Keras
Experience in online experimentation and statistical analysis, and communicating results and recommendations to senior stakeholders
Strong oral and written communication skills, and ability to collaborate with and influence cross-functional partners

Title: Director, Product & Brand Communications
RoleDescription:
At Lyft, our purpose is to serve and connect. To do this, we start with our own community by fostering a respectful and diverse organization where every voice is heard, valued, and empowered to contribute to our shared success.
We are seeking a strategic and visionary Director of Product and Brand Communications to play a pivotal leadership role in building a fresh take on an iconic brand. This highly visible and cross-functional position will drive the companys product narrative, giving riders and drivers compelling reasons to choose Lyft. 
As a vocal cross-functional partner with significant influence, you'll collaborate across departments to shape our brand story and product narratives. This role demands a strategic thinker who can craft compelling narratives for multiple audiences including riders, drivers, regulators, and the broader business community.
The successful candidate will be a resourceful self-starter who thrives in dynamic, fast-paced environments, demonstrating agility and adaptability as our company and industry evolve. You'll own the process for building and launching brand and product moments through multi-channel, earned media programs including narrative development, product demos, event planning, editorial extensions, and influencer engagement.
This is an opportunity to join a fun and hungry team and have a profound impact on the company. The role reports to the Vice President of Communications.
Responsibilities

Define compelling consumer and technology narratives that support the companys broader narrative and vision, and build a strategic and creative communications plan that strengthens Lyfts image and reputation with consumers. 
Provide strategic leadership for the Product and Brand Communications team, setting the vision, developing long-term plans, and fostering a high-performing team through mentorship, coaching, and professional development opportunities.
Drive the organization's communication strategy through cohesive messaging and orchestrated narrative drum beats, demonstrating the ability to influence and collaborate with senior leadership
Serve as a vocal leader and strategic partner across functions to ensure alignment and buy-in on narratives and strategic plans.
Work closely with product, marketing, legal, and policy teams to ensure consistent messaging and a unified brand experience across all touchpoints.
Develop and maintain media relationships with top-tier outlets, driving public relations campaigns that promote brand awareness and manage the company's public image.
Design and build integrated communications capability including across new and emerging platforms. Develop and maintain regular reporting mechanisms to communicate progress, insights, and recommendations to leadership and key stakeholders. 
Analyze data and insights to optimize communication strategies and maximize impact.

Experience

12+ years of communications experience with demonstrated success in technology products and services, especially in two-sided and/or highly regulated marketplaces. Public company experience preferred. 
Experience leading high performing teams and fostering collaborative cultures
Strong experience building constructive relationships with top tier reporters, editors and influencers. Has great media relationships / experiences and isnt afraid to pick up the phone to create new ones. 
Experience as a trusted communications advisor to business partners and executives, with demonstrated ability to influence at the senior leadership level
Not afraid to take big swings and go for the win!
Experience shaping and developing narratives that align with the company mission and resonate with audiences.
Thrives in complex situations and fast-paced environments. Dives deep and asks questions.
Excellent written and verbal communications skills.
Self-starter, independently motivated, leads oneself and influences others. Has experience managing a team in dynamic industries. 

Benefits

Great medical, dental, and vision insurance options with additional programs available when enrolled
Mental health benefits
Family building benefits
Child care and pet benefits
401(k) plan to help save for your future
In addition to 12 observed holidays, salaried team members have discretionary paid time off, hourly team members have 15 days paid time off
18 weeks of paid parental leave. Biological, adoptive, and foster parents are all eligible
